title: Russian deserters tell of blood, betrayal and hope in escaping Ukraine war
description: Fearing they will be killed in action, some conscripts thrown into battle in Ukraine are finding ways to abandon the Russian military and escape the country.

title: As George Santos faces expulsion from Congress, Brazilians hang their heads
description: The New York Republican is said to have been the first Brazilian American to be elected to the U.S. Congress. He hasn’t made his parents’ country proud.

title: Bombing restarts, casualties mount in Gaza as Israel-Hamas deal breaks down
description: Israeli officials said the fighting had resumed and the goal was now southern Gaza, where the U.S. has been pushing for a more targeted approach to spare civilian casualties.

title: How TikTokers and Swifties became political power brokers in Guatemala
description: They helped get an anti-corruption reformer elected president. But with weeks still to go before the inauguration, some of them are getting arrested.

title: U.N. chief says ‘Earth’s vital signs are failing’ as leaders meet at COP28
description: World leaders will address the U.N. Climate Change Conference, or COP28, on Friday in Dubai’s Expo City. Follow live updates on the summit and agenda highlights.

title: Pain and an uncertain future for Palestinian students shot in Vermont
description: The attack, which is being investigated as a potential hate crime, has sent a shock wave of fear across the college campuses where the three are studying.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Airstrikes resume in Gaza as pause in fighting ends
description: The pause in fighting between Israel and Hamas, which has allowed hostages to be freed, expired Friday. Israeli airstrikes resumed in southern Gaza.

title: Mexico wants you to adopt an axolotl, the amphibian that never grows up
description: Axolotls, a scientific wonder with regeneration capabilities, are racing toward extinction. Ecologists are giving the public an opportunity to adopt them.

title: Before China’s coal is even burned, its mines are warming the planet
description: The nation’s coal mines are major emitters of methane, and that is complicating global talks on reducing this potent greenhouse gas.

title: Here are the hostages released by Hamas and those remaining in Gaza
description: Some 110 hostages held by Hamas have been released; Some 130 are believed to be in Gaza. Here are names of those released and what we know about remaining hostages.

title: Gazans mourn loss of their libraries: Cultural beacons and communal spaces
description: Amid the destruction, residents have barely had the opportunity to grapple with the loss of the enclave’s few cultural institutions that locals recall as rare beacons of culture.

title: The Bengali blood on Henry Kissinger’s hands
description: Though most Americans have little recollection of it, Kissinger is remembered in South Asia for the part he and Nixon played during the bloody period that led to the emergence of the independent nation of Bangladesh in 1971.

title: Israel agrees to protect civilians when Gaza war resumes, Blinken says
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says he delivered a U.S. “imperative” that Israel adjust its combat strategy in Gaza to account for civilian collateral.

title: Eight hostages freed Thursday, as Blinken pushes Israel to protect civilian life after pause
description: Israel and Hamas agreed Thursday to extend for a seventh day the pause in fighting in Gaza.

title: Whistleblower alleges failures in medical care at U.S. border facilities
description: A Customs and Border Protection official filed a complaint with Congress alleging his supervisors failed to adequately monitor a medical services contractor
